thought: Since the website is accessible, I will now extract the text from the page to look for signs of unusually low prices, unrealistic money claims, and psychologically manipulative texts.
observation: Oil Paintings  sacred space faces behind the mask/reflection fruit Home - RECENT WORK - - inspired by faces sculpted by artists from past millennia - - originating from vastly diverse world cultures - - initially created to comfort, entertain, or commemorate... for eternity - - the painted portraits in oil universally explore... Riffs on Immortality Portraits of Sculpted Faces from the Stone Age to the Present The  series is a collaborative venture with Maureen Tracy Venti, a poet who splits her time between Key West and Jackson, New Hampshire. The T he Studios of Key West (tskw.org) July 18-August 8, 2013 The opening celebration featured poetry readings with jazz riffs, and a second line parade with Skipper Kripitz and The Conch Republic Marching Band Continuing Work SACRED SPACE dawn dusk STEP INTO THE SILENT TRANSCENDENT UNKNOWN color meditations in oil "In my work, I attempt to unite the viewer with the power of the sublime found in our visual environment.  Whether a color-saturated twilight sky, the expression of a human face, or the exquisite sculptural quality of a piece of fruit, the inspiration for my paintings derives primarily from nature and emerges intuitively.  The work is meant to evoke elemental emotions and an aesthetic arrest universal to the human spirit. Toward the end of my incredible year, I was fortunate to witness and photograph two elusive green flashes within a one-month period.  A green flash is a one-to-two-second refraction of light phenomenon that rarely appears, just a moment after  the sun sinks below the horizon." - Keith Bland NOVEMBER 23 DUSK, GREEN FLASH; oil on canvas; 60 x 84 inches Please click on the The 136-page book features 113 copyrighted photographs (including two green flashes), each also for sale on the website by title and page number in the book.  The photos are available framed or unframed, signed or unsigned, in varying sizes.  Please follow the instructions on the site using Paypal or email keith@keithbland.com to order books, photos, and/or paintings. Three of the six photographs (above) and the two oil paintings (below) that hang at the beautiful Methodist Hospice Residence in Memphis, Tennessee work has been featured in three solo exhibitions.  The first was held at The Studios of Key West (tskw.org), March 3 - 15, 2011. The second was hosted by the Memphis Botanic Garden, April 1 - 30, 2011, and the third at the galleries of Askew, Hargraves, Harcourt & Associates (A2H) in Lakeland, Tennessee.  In addition, two of the large paintings and six framed photos have been featured at gala openings of Phase 1 of the new Methodist Hospice Residence facility in Memphis.  The pieces were chosen and purchased as part of the highly successful Methodist Le Bonheur Hospital's new focus on fine art in hospitals. In January, 2012, the Florida Keys Council of the Arts selected three of the large paintings to hang in a very prominent location at the Key West International Airport (see below). Three 7 feet x 5 feet paintings in oil hang in the Key West International Airport. Commercial Advisors, Memphis, Tennessee "SILENCE IS SO ACCURATE."  Mark Rothko about the artist prices & fees contact information keith bland oil paintings :: key west florida :: new york city email: keith@keithbland.com Login CRUSH
